meanings.definition: The navel or center of something.
meanings.sent1: The omphalos of the town square is where everyone gathers.
meanings.sent2: The omphalos of a flower is where the petals meet.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the omphalos of the house was the warmest spot to nap.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the omphalos of the party, drawing everyone in.
meanings.sent5: The omphalos of the compass pointed north, guiding the lost hiker.

meanings.sent1: The omphalos of the discussion was the controversial topic.
meanings.sent2: The omphalos of the painting was the bright red flower in the center.
meanings.sent3: The omphalos of the movie plot was the unexpected twist at the end.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the omphalos of the room, spreading joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The omphalos of the map marked the location of the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: A stone or object marking the center of the world in ancient Greek mythology.
meanings.sent1: The omphalos in the myth was said to hold great power.
meanings.sent2: The omphalos stone was believed to connect the mortal world to the divine.
meanings.sent3: The omphalos artifact was rumored to grant wishes to those who found it.
meanings.sent4: The omphalos symbolized the balance between heaven and earth.
meanings.sent5: The omphalos was the key to unlocking the secrets of the universe in the ancient tale.
